result.execSummary:
All charges against Sadiki F Johnson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sadiki F Johnson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadiki F Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Sadiki F Johnson not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Motion of defense is granted. Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court by video, defendant Sadiki F Johnson not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 6-28-22

Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attoreny Hampton fail to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.8.22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sadiki F Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
